ygData.subject: Re: Banks
ygData.msgSnippet: Yeah they took care of twinking to a certain degree. Granted having Banded Mail at 1st level would certainly help you. However at 1st level your Offense and
ygData.messageBody:
Yeah they took care of twinking to a certain degree. Granted having Banded
Mail at 1st level would certainly help you. However at 1st level your
Offense and Defense are low, as is your weapon skill. Believe it our not, it
doesn't make a huge difference.

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ed Coyle [mailto:ecoyle@...]
> Sent: Friday, May 28, 1999 12:47 PM
> To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Banks
>
>
> From: "Ed Coyle" <ecoyle@...>
>
> It would take you several days to get up to 10th level, regardless of what
> armor or weapons you have. AC on a twinked character, even if he/she is
> wearing banded, is still not very high until you get to a higher
> level. You
> wouldn't be able to fight red MOBs very much, because even though
> you have a
> FS Longsword, your 1h slashing skill might only be 30.
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Lemac Justerian [mailto:lemac@...]
> > Sent: Friday, May 28, 1999 12:35 PM
> > To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
> > Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Banks
> >
> >
> > From: "Lemac Justerian" <lemac@...>
> >
> > Joint bank accounts wouldn't be that great of an idea... For the
> > reasons you
> > stated, it would, but it would be abused too easily to help
> > *twink* another
> > character up...
> >
> > I think you would start seeing even more (there already are some) lower
> > level characters wearing the best armor and having the best weapons that
> > money can buy because they are 'sharing' those items with the 'other'
> > player...
> >
> > In other words: I have a level 18 character that has all banded
> > armor and a
> > Combine Staff - I put it into the bank, log out, log back on as a NEW
> > character that is level 1... he puts on the armor, grabs the
> staff, and in
> > just a few hours he is up to level 10! Not worrying much about getting
> > killed off because his AC is around 300 or so!
> >
> > No, no sharing of accounts... BUT, I WOULD like to see some way
> > for GUILDS
> > to have a 'seperate' account (for officers) to make it easier to
> > handle the
> > income and outlay of the guilds...
>
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> With more than 17 million e-mails exchanged daily...
> http://www.onelist.com
> ...ONElist is THE place where the world talks!
>
